availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Richmond, Kentucky, native. Studied medicine at Transylvania University from 1836 to 1838. Practiced medicine in Barbourville, Kentucky. Admitted to the bar in 1847. Unsuccessful Emancipationist candidate for the Kentucky constitutional convention in 1849. Practiced law in Keokuk, Iowa, after 1850. Appointed an Associate Justice of the United States Supreme Court by Abraham Lincoln on July 16, 1862.

bibl.p: Charles Noble Gregory, "Samuel Freeman Miller: Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States" The Yale Law Journal 17, no. 6 (1908): 422-42.
